snippet: The bacteria that causes the disease can survive for months in amoebae that are common even in human eyes and noses, Colorado State scientists found.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS Neglected Tropical Diseases finds that bacteria that cause leprosy can survive for months inside amoebae hosts and even in human eyes and noses, helping to explain how disease manages to persist despite existence of medication to treat it.
lead_paragraph: The bacteria that causes the disease can survive for months in amoebae that are common even in human eyes and noses, Colorado State scientists found.

headline.print_headline: Research Finds a Reason Leprosy Has Persisted
